definitions.definition: ( US , informal ) To work as a substitute teacher, especially in primary and secondary education.
( British , informal , soccer ) To replace (a player) with a substitute.
examples: He never really made a contribution to the match, so it was no surprise when he was subbed at half time.

definitions.definition: ( British , informal , soccer , less common , often as "sub on" ) To bring on (a player) as a substitute.
examples: He was subbed on half way through the second half, and scored within minutes.

definitions.definition: ( British ) To perform the work of a subeditor or copy editor ; to subedit .
( slang , Internet , transitive ) To subtitle (usually a film or television program).
( UK , slang , transitive ) To lend (a person) money.
( BDSM ) To take a submissive role.

secondary_definitions: ( US , informal ) To work as a substitute teacher, especially in primary and secondary education.
( British , informal , soccer ) To replace (a player) with a substitute.
( British , informal , soccer , less common , often as "sub on" ) To bring on (a player) as a substitute.
( British ) To perform the work of a subeditor or copy editor ; to subedit .
( slang , Internet , transitive ) To subtitle (usually a film or television program).
( UK , slang , transitive ) To lend (a person) money.
( BDSM ) To take a submissive role.

definitions.definition: To coat with a layer of adhering material; to planarize by means of such a coating.
To prepare (a slide) with a layer of transparent substance to support and/or fix the sample.

main_definition: To coat with a layer of adhering material; to planarize by means of such a coating.
secondary_definitions: ( microscopy ) To prepare (a slide) with a layer of transparent substance to support and/or fix the sample.
